enigma_edit.lua.data

Class WoCallAPI20

  • java.lang.Object
    • enigma_edit.lua.data.Data
      • enigma_edit.lua.data.SourceData
        • enigma_edit.lua.data.WoCallAPI20
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Source, Typed, WoCall

    public class WoCallAPI20
extends SourceData
implements WoCall
    A call to the lua API function wo() creating the world. This class features a constructor for each overloaded signature of the wo function. On construction each if the arguments will be checked for the correct type and the width and height of the world should be determined.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class enigma_edit.lua.data.SourceData

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WoCallAPI20(Resolver resolver, Source libmap, Mode mode, CodeSnippet code)
      Call to wo(resolver, libmap) to create a world by the library libmap.
      WoCallAPI20(Resolver resolver, Source defaultkey, Source map, Mode mode, CodeSnippet code)
      Call to wo(resolver, defaultkey, map) to create a world from map.
      WoCallAPI20(Resolver resolver, Source defaultkey, Source width, Source height, Mode mode, CodeSnippet code)
      Call to wo(resolver, defaultkey, width, height) to create an empty level.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WoCallAPI20

        public WoCallAPI20(Resolver resolver,
                   Source defaultkey,
                   Source width,
                   Source height,
                   Mode mode,
                   CodeSnippet code)
            throws LevelLuaException.Runtime
        Call to wo(resolver, defaultkey, width, height) to create an empty level.
        Parameters:
        resolver - Resolver instance (already checked by the CodeAnalyser).
        defaultkey - Default tile key (should be a string).
        width - Width of the new world (should be an integer).
        height - Height of the new world (should be an integer).
        mode - Mode that wo was called in.
        code - Code snippet containing the call.
        Throws:
        LevelLuaException.Runtime

      • WoCallAPI20

        public WoCallAPI20(Resolver resolver,
                   Source defaultkey,
                   Source map,
                   Mode mode,
                   CodeSnippet code)
            throws LevelLuaException.Runtime
        Call to wo(resolver, defaultkey, map) to create a world from map.
        Parameters:
        resolver - Resolver instance (already checked by the CodeAnalyser).
        defaultkey - Default tile key (should be a string).
        map - World map (should be a table of strings).
        mode - Mode that wo was called in.
        code - Code snippet containing the call.
        Throws:
        LevelLuaException.Runtime

      • WoCallAPI20

        public WoCallAPI20(Resolver resolver,
                   Source libmap,
                   Mode mode,
                   CodeSnippet code)
            throws LevelLuaException.Runtime
        Call to wo(resolver, libmap) to create a world by the library libmap.
        Parameters:
        resolver - Resolver instance (already checked by the CodeAnalyser).
        libmap - World map (should be an instance of LibmapMap).
        mode - Mode that wo was called in.
        code - Code snippet containing the call.
        Throws:
        LevelLuaException.Runtime

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        public java.lang.String getKey(int x,
                               int y,
                               Mode2 mode)
        Return the specified field of the map. The returned value has the same length as the default key.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the field (1 <= x <= width)
        y - Y coordinate of the field (1 <= y <= height)
        mode - Use the map for this mode.
        Returns:
        Key at the specified position (x,y) on the map; or null, if the position is outside of the map.

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int x,
                    int y)
        Resolve the tile for the given position. This calls Resolver.resolve(java.lang.String, enigma_edit.lua.data.Mode) on the value returned by getKey(int, int, enigma_edit.lua.data.Mode2).
        Specified by:
        getTile in interface WoCall
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the field (1 <= x <= width)
        y - Y coordinate of the field (1 <= y <= height)
        Returns:
        ImageTile at the specified position (x,y) on the map; or null, if the position is outside of the map or if the resolver fails.

      • getDefaultTile

        public Tile getDefaultTile(Mode2 mode)
        Returns the tile declaration defined by the defaulttile argument.
        Specified by:
        getDefaultTile in interface WoCall
        Parameters:
        mode - Mode to resolve the tile for.
        Returns:
        Default tile for the given mode.

      • setKey

        java.lang.String setKey(int x,
                        int y,
                        java.lang.String newkey,
                        java.lang.String code,
                        Mode2 mode)
                 throws IllegalKeyLength
        Set the key at the specified position in the map. The key must have the same length as the default key. Note, that this returns a new String instance containing the new code. Since many code snippets (i.e. all snippets that start at the same position or after the modified line in the map definition within the source code) will be invalidated, the source code should be completely reanalysed after this operation.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the field (1 <= x <= width)
        y - Y coordinate of the field (1 <= y <= height)
        newkey - Key to replace the old value with.
        code - Level source code.
        mode - Mode to change the map for.
        Returns:
        The changed source code (or null, if the operation failed).
        Throws:
        IllegalKeyLength - Thrown, if the length of the given newkey differs from the default key length of this map.

        public int getWidth(Mode mode)
        Description copied from interface: WoCall
        Get the worlds width (in tiles).
        Specified by:
        getWidth in interface WoCall
        Parameters:
        mode - Mode to check the world for.
        Returns:
        The width of the requested world (in tiles). Or -1, in case of non-unique result.
